junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> Yes, in the ideal world, the numbers would b=
e small, so
> "wading through them" to find the cause of the failure would
=
> be relatively trivial.  Unfortunately, my world is not ideal,
> and there=
 are lots of coverage failures and still some real
> failures.  In order to=
 focus on the real failures, instead of
> allowing people to hide behind th=
e false belief (or wish)
> that the new failures are just coverage, we had =
to pull
> hansel out.

I'd only use hansel on classes that *have* full cove=
rage, that is on classes
where hansel shouldn't report failure.

I agree th=
at having unit tests failure that don't need to be immediately
fixed is sub=
optimal.

Cheers, Ilja
